intro: Josephia hewardiana, commonly known as the Heward's lily, is a striking flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink blooms that are highly fragrant, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
